title: Authors and Citation
text: Simon Garnier. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Garnier S (2023). swaRm: Processing Collective Movement Data. R package version 0.6.0,  https://github.com/swarm-lab/swaRm, https://swarm-lab.github.io/swaRm/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {swaRm: Processing Collective Movement Data},   author = {Simon Garnier},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 0.6.0,  https://github.com/swarm-lab/swaRm},   url = {https://swarm-lab.github.io/swaRm/}, }

title: Processing Collective Movement Data
text: swaRm R package meant standardize accelerate processing data describing movements animal human groups (e.g. fish schools, bird flocks). swaRm work progress. Functions yet stable state likely change package gets developed.

title: Angular Acceleration — ang_acc
text: Given set locations defining trajectory, function   approximates instantaneous angular accelerations computed   difference successive angular speeds.

title: Angular Acceleration — ang_acc
code: ang_acc(x, y, t, geo = FALSE)  angAcc(x, y, t, geo = FALSE)

title: Angular Acceleration — ang_acc
text: x vector x (longitude) coordinates corresponding single  trajectory. y vector y (latitude) coordinates corresponding single  trajectory. t vector timestamps corresponding single trajectory. geo logical value indicating whether locations defined  geographic coordinates (pairs longitude/latitude values). Default: FALSE.

title: Angular Acceleration — ang_acc
text: vector length x, y t corresponding  approximated instantaneous angular accelerations along trajectory.

title: Angular Acceleration — ang_acc
text: Simon Garnier, garnier@njit.edu

title: Angular Speeds — ang_speed
text: Given set locations defining trajectory, function   approximates instantaneous instantaneous angular speeds computed   difference successive headings divided time   successive headings.

title: Angular Speeds — ang_speed
code: ang_speed(x, y, t, geo = FALSE)  angSpeed(x, y, t, geo = FALSE)

title: Angular Speeds — ang_speed
text: x vector x (longitude) coordinates corresponding single  trajectory. y vector y (latitude) coordinates corresponding single  trajectory. t vector timestamps corresponding single trajectory. geo logical value indicating whether locations defined  geographic coordinates (pairs longitude/latitude values). Default: FALSE.

title: Angular Speeds — ang_speed
text: vector length x, y t corresponding   approximated instantaneous angular speeds along trajectory.

title: Angular Speeds — ang_speed
text: Simon Garnier, garnier@njit.edu

title: Centroid — centroid
text: function computes centroid (center mass) set   x-y (longitude-latitude) coordinates.

title: Centroid — centroid
code: centroid(x, y, robust = FALSE, geo = FALSE)

title: Centroid — centroid
text: x vector x (longitude) coordinates. y vector y (latitude) coordinates. robust logical value indicating whether compute centroid simple average coordinates (FALSE, default), average  coordinates weighted inverse mean pairwise distance  coordinates set (TRUE). geo logical value indicating whether locations defined  geographic coordinates (pairs longitude/latitude values). Default: FALSE.

title: Centroid — centroid
text: two-element list corresponding location centroid.

title: Centroid — centroid
text: Simon Garnier, garnier@njit.edu

what: Surface Area of the Convex Hull — chull_area
title: Surface Area of the Convex Hull — chull_area
text: Given set locations, function determines surface   area convex hull (envelope) set.

title: Surface Area of the Convex Hull — chull_area
code: chull_area(x, y, geo = FALSE)  chullArea(x, y, geo = FALSE)

title: Surface Area of the Convex Hull — chull_area
text: x vector x (longitude) coordinates. y vector y (latitude) coordinates. geo logical value indicating whether locations defined  geographic coordinates (pairs longitude/latitude values). TRUE,  surface area returned square meters. FALSE,  returned square units [x,y] coordinates. Default:  FALSE.

title: Surface Area of the Convex Hull — chull_area
text: single numeric value corresponding surface area   convex hull (square meters geo TRUE).

title: Surface Area of the Convex Hull — chull_area
text: Simon Garnier, garnier@njit.edu

title: Surface Area of the Convex Hull — chull_area
code: x <- rnorm(25) y <- rnorm(25, sd = 3) chull_area(x, y) #> [1] 21.44376

what: Perimeter of the Convex Hull — chull_perimeter
title: Perimeter of the Convex Hull — chull_perimeter
text: Given set locations, function determines perimeter   convex hull (envelope) set.

title: Perimeter of the Convex Hull — chull_perimeter
code: chull_perimeter(x, y, geo = FALSE)  chullPerimeter(x, y, geo = FALSE)

title: Perimeter of the Convex Hull — chull_perimeter
text: x vector x (longitude) coordinates. y vector y (latitude) coordinates. geo logical value indicating whether locations defined  geographic coordinates (pairs longitude/latitude values). TRUE,  perimeter returned meters. FALSE, returned  units [x,y] coordinates. Default: FALSE.

title: Perimeter of the Convex Hull — chull_perimeter
text: single numeric value corresponding perimeter convex   hull (meters geo TRUE).

title: Perimeter of the Convex Hull — chull_perimeter
text: Simon Garnier, garnier@njit.edu

title: Perimeter of the Convex Hull — chull_perimeter
code: x <- rnorm(25) y <- rnorm(25, sd = 3) chull_perimeter(x, y) #> [1] 27.53885

title: Distances to the Centroid — dist2centroid
text: x vector x (longitude) coordinates. y vector y (latitude) coordinates. robust logical value indicating whether compute centroid simple average coordinates (FALSE, default), average  coordinates weighted inverse mean pairwise distance  coordinates set (TRUE). geo logical value indicating whether locations defined  geographic coordinates (pairs longitude/latitude values). Default: FALSE.

title: Distances to the Centroid — dist2centroid

code: .cartesianPerimeter(x, y)  rot_order(x, y, h)  rotOrder(h, x, y)

title: Rotational Order Parameter — .cartesianPerimeter
text: x vector x (longitude) coordinates. y vector y (latitude) coordinates. h vector headings (radians).

title: Rotational Order Parameter — .cartesianPerimeter
text: single value 0 1 corresponding rotational   order parameter group.

title: Rotational Order Parameter — .cartesianPerimeter
text: Simon Garnier, garnier@njit.edu

title: Rotational Order Parameter — .cartesianPerimeter
code: x <- rnorm(25) y <- rnorm(25, sd = 3) h <- runif(25, 0, 2 * pi) rot_order(x, y, h) #> [1] 0.2065161

title: Sinuosity — sinuosity
text: Given set successive step lengths turning angles,  function computes sinuosity trajectory defined Benhamou (2004),   equation 8.  corrected version sinuosity index defined   Bovet & Benhamou (1988), suitable wider range turning   angle distributions, require constant step length.

title: Sinuosity — sinuosity
text: step_lengths vector step lengths calculated  linear_dist. turning_angles vector turning angles calculated  ang_speed.

title: Sinuosity — sinuosity
text: single numeric value corresponding sinuosity   trajectory.

title: Sinuosity — sinuosity
text: Benhamou, S. (2004). reliably estimate tortuosity   animal’s path: straightness, sinuosity, fractal dimension? Journal   Theoretical Biology, 229(2), 209–220. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jtbi.2004.03.016 Bovet, P., & Benhamou, S. (1988). Spatial analysis animals’ movements   using correlated random walk model. Journal Theoretical Biology, 131(4),   419–433. https://doi.org/10.1016/S0022-5193(88)80038-9

title: Sinuosity — sinuosity
text: Simon Garnier, garnier@njit.edu

title: Sinuosity — sinuosity
code: x <- rnorm(25) y <- rnorm(25, sd = 3) t <- as.POSIXct(1:25, origin = Sys.time()) step_lengths <- linear_dist(x, y) turning_angles <- ang_speed(x, y, t) sinuosity(step_lengths, turning_angles) #> [1] 0.939138

title: Sphericity — sphericity
text: Given set locations, function approximates   sphericity set calculating bivariate 95  set.

title: Sphericity — sphericity
text: x vector x coordinates. y vector y coordinates.

title: Sphericity — sphericity
text: single numeric value corresponding ratio minor   major axis bivariate 95 close 1 indicates set approximately circular; value close   0 indicates set strongly elongated.

title: Sphericity — sphericity
text: Simon Garnier, garnier@njit.edu

title: Sphericity — sphericity
code: x <- rnorm(25) y <- rnorm(25, sd = 3) sphericity(x, y) #> [1] 0.4901357
